universum.studios.android.recycler.decoration

Class ItemDividerDecoration

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ItemDecoration
      • universum.studios.android.recycler.decoration.RecyclerViewItemDecoration
        • universum.studios.android.recycler.decoration.ItemDividerDecoration

  • public class ItemDividerDecoration
extends RecyclerViewItemDecoration
    A RecyclerViewItemDecoration implementation that may be used to draw a divider (drawable or color), vertically or horizontally, between items displayed in a RecyclerView widget.

    Xml attributes

    ItemDividerDecoration Attributes

    Default style attribute

    none
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky
    See Also:
    RecyclerView.addItemDecoration(RecyclerView.ItemDecoration)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ItemDividerDecoration.Orientation
      Defines an annotation for determining allowed orientations for ItemDividerDecoration.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class universum.studios.android.recycler.decoration.RecyclerViewItemDecoration

    • Constructor Detail

      • ItemDividerDecoration

        public ItemDividerDecoration()
        Same as ItemDividerDecoration(Context) with null context.

      • ItemDividerDecoration

        public ItemDividerDecoration(int orientation,
                             @NonNull
                             Drawable divider)
        Creates a new instance of ItemDividerDecoration with the specified orientation and divider.
        Parameters:
        orientation - The desired orientation in which should be the divider drawn. One of orientation defined by @Orientation annotation.
        divider - Drawable of the desired divider to be drawn. If this is a ColorDrawable the divider's thickness need to be specified via setDividerThickness(int) as the color drawable does not have its intrinsic dimensions specified.
        See Also:
        setOrientation(int), setDivider(Drawable)

      • ItemDividerDecoration

        public ItemDividerDecoration(@Nullable
                             Context context)
        Same as ItemDividerDecoration(Context, AttributeSet) with null attrs.

      • ItemDividerDecoration

        public ItemDividerDecoration(@Nullable
                             Context context,
                             @Nullable
                             AttributeSet attrs)
        Same as ItemDividerDecoration(Context, AttributeSet, int) with 0 defStyleAttr.

      • ItemDividerDecoration

        public ItemDividerDecoration(@Nullable
                             Context context,
                             @Nullable
                             AttributeSet attrs,
                             @AttrRes
                             int defStyleAttr)
        Same as ItemDividerDecoration(Context, AttributeSet, int, int) with 0 defStyleRes.

      • ItemDividerDecoration

        public ItemDividerDecoration(@Nullable
                             Context context,
                             @Nullable
                             AttributeSet attrs,
                             @AttrRes
                             int defStyleAttr,
                             @StyleRes
                             int defStyleRes)
        Creates a new instance of ItemDividerDecoration for the given context.
        Parameters:
        context - Context in which will be the new decoration presented.
        attrs - Set of Xml attributes used to configure the new instance of this decoration.
        defStyleAttr - An attribute which contains a reference to a default style resource for this decoration within a theme of the given context.
        defStyleRes - Resource id of the default style for the new decoration.

    • Method Detail

      • setOrientation

        public void setOrientation(int orientation)
        Sets an orientation in which should be the divider specified for this decoration drawn.

        Default value: VERTICAL

        Parameters:
        orientation - The desired orientation. Should be one of orientations defined by @Orientation annotation.
        See Also:
        getOrientation()

      • getOrientation

        public int getOrientation()
        Returns the orientation in which is the divider drawable drawn between items.
        Returns:
        This decoration's orientation.
        See Also:
        setOrientation(int)

      • setDivider

        public void setDivider(@Nullable
                       Drawable divider)
        Sets a drawable of the divider to be drawn between items of the associated RecyclerView in the orientation specified for this decoration.

        Note that calling this method will reset any thickness value specified via setDividerThickness(int) before and the thickness of the given divider drawable will be used instead depending on the orientation specified for this decoration.

        Parameters:
        divider - The desired divider drawable. May be null to to not draw any divider.
        See Also:
        getDivider()

      • getDivider

        @Nullable
public Drawable getDivider()
        Returns the divider drawable that is drawn by this decoration between items.
        Returns:
        This decorations's divider drawable. May by null if no divider has been specified.
        See Also:
        setDivider(Drawable)

      • setDividerThickness

        public void setDividerThickness(int thickness)
        Sets a thickness in which should be the divider specified for this decoration drawn.

        Note that calling this method will override the intrinsic thickness obtained form the divider drawable when setDivider(Drawable) has been called.

        Parameters:
        thickness - The desired thickness. May be 0 to not draw the divider.
        See Also:
        getDividerThickness()

      • getDividerThickness

        public int getDividerThickness()
        Returns the thickness in which should be the divider drawn between items.
        Returns:
        The divider's thickness.
        See Also:
        setDividerThickness(int)

      • setDividerOffset

        public void setDividerOffset(int start,
                             int end)
        Specifies amounts by which to offset the divider.

        Both values are used with respect to layout direction of the parent RecyclerView and also with respect to the orientation specified for this decoration.

        Parameters:
        start - The desired amount in pixels by which to offset the divider at the start.
        end - The desired amount in pixels by which to offset the divider at the end.
        See Also:
        getDividerOffsetStart(), getDividerOffsetEnd()

      • getDividerOffsetStart

        public int getDividerOffsetStart()
        Returns the amount by which to offset the divider at the start.

        This value is used with respect to layout direction of the parent RecyclerView and also with respect to the orientation specified for this decoration.

        Returns:
        Offset in pixels.
        See Also:
        setDividerOffset(int, int)

      • getDividerOffsetEnd

        public int getDividerOffsetEnd()
        Returns the amount by which to offset the divider at the end.

        This value is used with respect to layout direction of the parent RecyclerView and also with respect to the orientation specified for this decoration.

        Returns:
        Offset in pixels.
        See Also:
        setDividerOffset(int, int)

      • getItemOffsets

        public void getItemOffsets(@NonNull
                           Rect rect,
                           @NonNull
                           View view,
                           @NonNull
                           RecyclerView parent,
                           @NonNull
                           RecyclerView.State state)
        Overrides:
        getItemOffsets in class RecyclerView.ItemDecoration

      • updateItemOffsets

        protected void updateItemOffsets(@NonNull
                                 Rect rect,
                                 boolean rtlDirection)
        Called to update the given rect with the current divider thickness and divider offsets specified for this decoration according to the orientation also specified for this decoration.
        Parameters:
        rect - The desired item offsets rect to be updated.
        rtlDirection - True if offsets should be updated for RTL layout direction, false for LTR layout direction.

      • onDraw

        public void onDraw(@NonNull
                   Canvas canvas,
                   @NonNull
                   RecyclerView parent,
                   @NonNull
                   RecyclerView.State state)
        Overrides:
        onDraw in class RecyclerView.ItemDecoration

      • shouldDecorate

        protected boolean shouldDecorate(@NonNull
                                 RecyclerView parent,
                                 @NonNull
                                 RecyclerView.State state)
        Description copied from class: RecyclerViewItemDecoration
        Checks whether any subsequent decoration algorithm should be applied by this decoration for the given parent RecyclerView and its current state.

        This implementation checks whether the given RecyclerView has its RecyclerView.LayoutManager specified by RecyclerView.getLayoutManager() != null and if there are any items to be decorated by RecyclerView.State.getItemCount() > 0. If both conditions are met, this method returns true, if not, false is returned.

        Overrides:
        shouldDecorate in class RecyclerViewItemDecoration
        Parameters:
        parent - The RecyclerView into which is this decoration added.
        state - Current state of the parent RecyclerView.
        Returns:
        True if decorating should be performed, false otherwise.

      • onDrawHorizontally

        protected void onDrawHorizontally(@NonNull
                                  Canvas canvas,
                                  @NonNull
                                  RecyclerView parent,
                                  @NonNull
                                  RecyclerView.State state)
        Called from RecyclerView.ItemDecoration.onDrawOver(Canvas, RecyclerView, RecyclerView.State) in order to draw this decoration in vertical orientation.
        Parameters:
        canvas - Canvas on which to draw.
        parent - RecyclerView into which is this decoration added.
        state - Current state of the parent RecyclerView.

      • onDrawVertically

        protected void onDrawVertically(@NonNull
                                Canvas canvas,
                                @NonNull
                                RecyclerView parent,
                                @NonNull
                                RecyclerView.State state)
        Called from RecyclerView.ItemDecoration.onDrawOver(Canvas, RecyclerView, RecyclerView.State) in order to draw this decoration in horizontal orientation.
        Parameters:
        canvas - Canvas on which to draw.
        parent - RecyclerView into which is this decoration added.
